root.speaker: Mom
root.text: How was school today, sweetie? You look tired. Are you eating enough? I made lasagna.

choices.text: It was fine, Mom. Can I eat in my room? I have to study.
choices.internal_monologue: (The lasagna is really good. You'll regret this.)

choices.text: Lasagna! Yeah, let me tell you about this insane thing Sam did today.
choices.internal_monologue: (Mom laughs at the story. This is nice. You won't remember this moment in 10 years. You should.)

choices.text: I need to work on my college applications. Can we talk later?

mom_study_response.speaker: Mom
mom_study_response.text: Of course, honey. I'll leave a plate outside your door. Don't stay up too late, okay?

choices.internal_monologue: (The plate will still be there at midnight. Untouched. She'll find it in the morning and say nothing.)

mom_happy_dinner.speaker: Mom
mom_happy_dinner.text: Ha! That Sam. You two have been friends since what, third grade? Don't ever lose that, okay?

choices.text: Yeah... Hey Mom, do you think I'll get into a good school?
choices.internal_monologue: (You need her to say yes. She always says yes. That's the problem.)

mom_applications_response.speaker: Mom
mom_applications_response.text: ...Sure. The lasagna will be in the fridge.

choices.internal_monologue: (She paused before 'Sure.' You noticed. You kept walking anyway.)

mom_college_talk.speaker: Mom
mom_college_talk.text: Sweetie, you could get into anywhere. But... you know what matters more than the name on the diploma, right?

choices.internal_monologue: (You mean it right now. Right now counts for something.)

choices.text: Sure, Mom. I should go study though.
choices.internal_monologue: (She was about to say something else. The moment passes.)
